page.title: 11LOWER REDBROOK: CHANGES
page.content: {House exteriors}in 1945 were similar to those today.{Inside}they were very different. Now most are{centrally {heated,}though some are still heated by{coal fires}as then. Kitchens today are better equipped with micro-wave ovens,automatic washing machines, dryers and food mixers.Kitchen{gardens were big and lawns and flower beds small.Now the reverse is usually true.The{school}had a large garden at the King's Head Hotel. In 1945 there were three full time teachers and three{classrooms.}Now there are two teachers and two larger classrooms. {Evacuees}from London and Hastings increased the number of children in Redbrook School during the war. In 1945 most of them returned home. Children from Gwent were then allowed to come to the school.Later they could not, but now they can again.
